recipes.title: Vibrant Bell Pepper & Onion Scramble with Buttery Toast
instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs with milk, salt, pepper, and optional hot sauce until well combined.
Heat 1 tbsp butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the diced red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and yellow onion. Sauté for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet with the sautéed vegetables. Let it set for about 30 seconds without stirring.

Gently push the cooked egg from the edges towards the center, allowing the uncooked egg to flow underneath. Continue cooking and gently stirring until the scramble is cooked through but still moist, about 3-5 minutes.
While eggs are cooking, toast the bread. Spread 1 tsp butter on the warm toast.
Serve the vibrant scramble immediately, garnished with fresh lettuce leaves and alongside the buttery toast.

recipes.title: Crisp Apple & Cucumber Salad with Tangy Yogurt Dressing
instructions: In a large salad bowl, combine the chopped lettuce, thinly sliced cucumber, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, yellow onion, and apple slices.
In a small bowl, whisk together the plain yogurt, orange juice, mustard, olive oil, salt, and black pepper until the dressing is smooth and well combined.
Pour the tangy yogurt dressing over the salad ingredients.
Gently toss the salad until all the vegetables and apple slices are evenly coated with the dressing.
Serve immediately as a refreshing side or a light meal.

recipes.title: Classic Egg Salad Toasts with Zesty Relish & Pickles
instructions: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to a rolling boil over high heat, then immediately remove from heat, cover, and let stand for 10-12 minutes.
Drain the hot water and transfer eggs to an ice bath for 5 minutes to cool completely. Peel the cooled eggs and chop them into small pieces.
In a medium bowl, combine the chopped eggs, mayonnaise, sweet relish, mustard, finely chopped pickles, salt, pepper, and optional hot sauce. Mix gently until just combined.
Toast the bread slices. Spread 1 tbsp butter evenly over the warm toast.
Lay a few fresh lettuce leaves on each slice of buttered toast, then spoon a generous amount of the egg salad mixture over the lettuce.
Serve immediately as an open-faced sandwich or a hearty snack.
